pages.title: CLASSIFIED
pages.text: $(bold)ORSA-UN JOINT ASSESSMENT$()$(br2)RE: Projected conditions following orbital destabilization$(br2)The following is our best estimate of what Earth will experience as it drifts from the Sun.$(br2)Timeline assumes ~100 day progression.$(br2)$(italic)Note: This document was originally classified. It has been declassified because there is no one left to classify things for.$()

pages.title: Phase 0-1
pages.text: $(bold)Phase 0: "The Last Normal Days"$()$(br)Days 0-5. No immediate effects. Sun appears normal. Use this time to gather resources and prepare underground shelter.$(br2)$(bold)Phase 1: "Twilight"$()$(br)Days 5-12. Sun visibly shrinks. Rain becomes frequent. Temperatures begin to drop.

pages.title: Phase 2-3
pages.text: $(bold)Phase 2: "Cooling"$()$(br)Days 12-22. Temp: -10°C. Permanent rain/snow. Water begins to freeze. Vegetation starts dying.$(br2)$(bold)Phase 3: "The Long Night"$()$(br)Days 22-34. Temp: -25°C. Permanent thunderstorms. Lava begins to cool. Fog rolls in.

pages.title: Phase 4-5
pages.text: $(bold)Phase 4: "Deep Freeze"$()$(br)Days 34-46. Temp: -45°C. Surface is lethal. Obsidian freezes. Coal ore crystallizes. Dense fog, near darkness.$(br2)$(bold)Phase 5: "Eternal Winter"$()$(br)Days 46-60. Temp: -70°C to -120°C. Permanent midnight. Blizzard whiteout. Nether portals collapse — dimensional lines severed.

pages.title: Phase 6
pages.text: $(bold)Phase 6: "Atmospheric Collapse"$()$(br)Days 60-100. Temp: -120°C to -273°C$(br2)$(italic)Early:$() Extreme blizzard.$(br)$(italic)Mid:$() Atmosphere thins, wind dies, fog lifts.$(br)$(italic)Late:$() Vacuum conditions. Stars visible. No sound on surface. Ice sublimates. Suffocation without shelter.

pages.title: Survival Recommendations
pages.text: $(li)Establish underground base below Y=0$(li)Secure heat sources BEFORE Phase 3$(li)Build a Geothermal Core for late-game$(li)Any roofed structure traps breathable air$(li)Deeper = warmer$(br2)Good luck. You are statistically the unluckiest person alive. But also the luckiest, because you $(italic)are$() alive.$(br2)$(italic)— ORSA Science Division$(br)(We're rooting for you. Quietly. From Mars.)$()
